options.A: Stigmas are usually large and feathery
options.C: The pollen grains have rough spiny surfaces

quiz.question: Some of the features of an animal are scales, teeth, nares, and backbone. The animal is likely to be a?

Flatworms and roundworms are said to be invertebrates because?

options.B: they can live inside the vertebrates

quiz.question: When a Spirogyra cell is immersed in a salt solution more concentrated than its cell sap, it?
Which of the following is NOT regarded as a pollutant on land or in the air?
The initial volume of water poured into a bag of dry soil was 50ml and the amount that drained through was 35ml. The percentage water content of the fully soaked soil is therefore?
When the original king and queen of termites die, they are replaced by

options.A: the king and queen of another colony
options.B: some adult reproductives from the same colony
options.C: some adult workers which are specially fed to breed
options.D: developing nymphs nurtured as secondary reproductives

quiz.question: In demonstrating the importance of mineral elements in plants, the culture bottle must be darkened to?

options.A: prevent algal growth in culture solution

quiz.question: In the mammalian respiratory system, exchange of gases occurs in the?

The villus in the small intestine is significant because it?

options.A: increases the surface area for absorption
options.B: increases the surface area for digestion

quiz.question: Which of the following food substances will produce a brick-red colour when warmed with Benedict's solution?

Which of the following is TRUE of the process of conjugation in Paramecium?

Which of the following is a measure for the control of bilharzia?

options.B: Application of molluscicides in water bodies
options.C: Screening windows and doors with mosquito nets
options.D: Application of herbicides in water bodies

quiz.question: The appendicular skeleton is composed of the pectoral girdle?

options.A: pelvic girdle, fore and hind limbs
options.D: lumbar vertebrae, fore and hind limbs

quiz.question: A freshwater plant such as water lily can solve the problem of buoyancy by the possession of?

options.C: thin cell walls of the epidermis

quiz.question: The correct sequence for the perception of smell in mammals is?

options.B: dissolved chemicals → nasal sensory cells → brain
options.C: chemicals → mucus membrane sensory cells → brain
options.D: dissolved chemicals → sensory cells → olfactory nerve → brain

quiz.question: Which combination of the following can cause rapid over-crowding in climax biotic communities and human settlements? I. High birth rate and high immigration rate II. Low birth rate and high immigration rate III. Low mortality rate and low emigration rate IV. High mortality rate and high emigration rate

The number of plant species obtained from a population study of a garden is as follows: Guinea grass (15), Ipomoea spp (5), Sida spp (7) and Imperata spp (23). What is the percentage of occurrence of Imperata spp?
When a marine fish was taken from the ocean and put in a tank of fresh water, it died after a short period because?

options.A: the tank was too small compared to the large ocean
options.B: the body cells of the fish swelled and burst as a result of the hypotonic fresh water
options.C: the body cells of the fish shrank as their sap was hypertonic to the freshwater
options.D: there was no food in the tank, so the fish starved

The correct sequence of the movement of urea during urine formation is?

options.A: glomerulus → Bowman's capsule → convoluted tubule → Henle's loop → collecting tubule
options.B: glomerulus → Bowman's capsule → convoluted tubule → Henle's loop → convoluted tubule → collecting tubule
options.C: convoluted tubule → glomerulus → Henle's loop → Bowman's capsule → collecting tubule
options.D: convoluted tubule → Bowman's capsule → Henle's loop → glomerulus → collecting tubule

quiz.question: The order of passage of food in the digestive system is?

Which of the following is true in blood transfusion?

options.A: A person of blood group AB can donate blood only to another person of blood group AB
options.B: Persons of blood groups A and B can donate or receive blood from each other
options.C: A person of blood group AB can receive blood only from persons of blood group A or B
options.D: A person of blood group O can donate only to a person of blood group O

The mutation theory of organic evolution was propounded by?
If both parents are heterozygous for a trait, the probability that an offspring will be recessive for that trait is?
Blood circulation in a mammal is said to be double because?

options.A: it passes twice through the heart in a complete circuit
options.B: it moves in both arteries and veins
options.C: it circulates in both the heart and other organs
options.D: the heart contains auricles and ventricles
